revised_title: Dynamics of Near-Wall Turbulence and Vortex Interactions
tldr: This article investigates the structure and dynamics of turbulent flow near walls, focusing on the role of vortices in the production and evolution of turbulence. The authors propose a model that explains how vortices interact with the wall layer and contribute to the cyclic behavior of turbulent surface flows. They also discuss the importance of understanding these dynamics for potential control and drag reduction methods.
